comment: I don't know where to start. Probably the worst professor I've had. The problem with her class is that it's very pass or fail. If you don't do an assignment PERFECT she will give you a zero regardless of how close you are to the solution. Just awful. (Will also let students she likes redo assignments but not all students)

Her instructions can be unclear at times but she is flexible on labs. Homework must be done on a certain deadline. She is willing to answer questions. Her feedback is firm but fair. As a graduate course it is expected that you do your work to understand material. For the group project, your project needs to be manageable.

She is one of the worst professors that I had ever came across, very discouraging , besides she just reads the lecture from book, its not actually explaining, very rude, doesn't care if we had doubts, her way of evaluation is too tough.I would not encourage anyone to take her course. I ended up with neither knowledge nor good grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! She expects you to understand it like she does. She doesn't listen and when you ask her questions she becomes defensive and mean. Grades harshly and could care less if students understand or not. In short if I would NEVER TAKE her again. Even if she was the last professor left on earth lol

It is sad that she is the best professor KSU provides for such core graduate course . She is neither helpful nor capable in teaching the course. She doesn't listen to begin with. PLEASE never take a course with her! You will learn nothing other than working on excruciating & irrelevant assignments week in & out. Her grading system is mediocre.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Hard to understand what she is saying in lecture at times due to heavy accent. Homeworks are lengthy and coupled with the pace mean you will be spending loads of time on this class. She tests very specific things mentioned in lectures so be prepared to pay attention, watch every lecture, and take good notes.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awful. She is the worst professor I've had as far as grading assignments goes. She will literally find something, ANYTHING to take points away from you. And she just picks a random, arbitrary number to deduct from your assignment. Usually, the points are deducted simply because she is confused or doesn't understand what you're saying.

Worst professor I have ever encountered throughout all of my years of education. She refuses to answer any questions (regardless of how small) and tells you to figure them out by yourself. She tests things that are not only not presented in class, but are not even in the book (which you MUST read because the lectures do not go over enough).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Avoid this professor as much as you can. Her accent  sometimes creates a difficulty to follow her. She doesn't like to be asked a question. The course was advanced graduate level course but she focused on the easier under graduate level part for most of the semester. More than half of the students in the class dropped this course.

She uses the Similarity Test provided by D2L. I submitted my homework and got flagged for using terminologies from lectures and textbook. I also got flagged for using the data provided.  No clear explanations. If you don't understand something, she only repeats what she said earlier, that's not a better explanation.

Jing (Selena) He was a fair and very approachable professor. Took CS7020 Mobile Development course which was Android programming using Java. This was her first time using IntelliJ IDE instead of Eclipse and it was a bit bumpy.  She rewarded hard work and effort.  Had weekly programming assignments, so you'll stay busy.  Book wasn't much help.

Selena (her American name) was well prepared, diligent, helpful and made students work in the class. She provided guidance on writing an academic paper including templates.  Learned quite a bit in class. Class was Wireless & Mobile Computing.
